title: When can you start college or university after your high school graduation? - Quora

response.answer_text: Whenever you want to because any age is fine. If you think some age is late, times have positively changed because NO age is late. If you don't have a good academic background from high school you need and have to have it in college or university. College is only a four year school and university is a four year school plus a graduate school. You'll need and have to have a good academic background in grad school. Glad to see you're asking about your four college degree!

The difference between a university and a college has nothing to do with an undergraduate’s opportunity. So, of course, the answer is yes! The term “college” refers to undergraduate programs that provide a B.A. or B.S. degree. All universities provide undergraduate programs (i.e. a college degree). If a post-secondary school is labeled a “college” it just means that they do not offer post-graduate degrees! So one can attend/be admitted to a university or a college after graduating high school. Their curriculum will be just about the same…though the undergraduate requirements may differ slightly.
